moves.3. Nc3: Here I deviate from Gameknot's database.
moves.3... Bb4 4. f3: Do you have any idea of what opening this is? I'm too lazy to look it up. :)
moves.4... exd4 5. Qxd4 Bxc3+ 6. Qxc3: I wanted to keep my Kingside pawns strong.
moves.6... dxe4 7. Qxg7: This is the first of two beautiful combinations.
moves.9. Kxf2: Perhaps better was Ke2 or something along those lines.
moves.21. h4: Here I began to push my h-pawn so that I might mate him.
moves.22. Rxb8 Re7+ 23. Kf4: Bringing Henry to constrict the other King.
moves.24. h5: Here begins the second of the two combinations.
moves.24... Kh6 25. Nf3 Kg7: Can you find the mating sequence?
moves.26. h6+ Kg6 27. Nh4+ Kh5: I expected Kxh6, but the result is the same.
moves.28. Nf5+ Kg6 29. Rg8+ Rg7 30. Rxg7#: There it is!! Thank you irwinblock for this memorable game! Please rate and comment.
